abstract: Remains of female World War II pilot Elaine D Harmon are finally laid to rest at Arlington National Cemetery, in accordance with her wishes and following successful effort by Arizona Rep Martha McSally and Iowa Sen Joni Ernst to confirm her eligibility for national honor.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: The remains of Elaine D. Harmon, who died in 2015, were laid to rest, representing a triumph for the WASPs, an often forgotten part of the war effort.
snippet: The remains of Elaine D. Harmon, who died in 2015, were laid to rest, representing a triumph for the WASPs, an often forgotten part of the war effort....

headline.main: A Female World War II Pilot Is Finally an Equal at Arlington
headline.print_headline: A World War II Pilot Is Finally an Equal at Arlington
